sn1.34:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn1.34:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, a number of devatās belonging to the Satullapa host, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One. Having approached, they paid homage to the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn1.34:1.3: Then one devatā, standing to one side, recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.34:2.1: “There are among humans No permanent sensual pleasures;
sn1.34:2.2: Here there are just desirable things.
sn1.34:2.3: Heedless in their midst, when a person is bound to these,
sn1.34:2.4: From Death’s realm he does not reach the state of no-more-coming-back. ”
sn1.34:3.1: “Misery is born of desire; suffering is born of desire.
sn1.34:3.2: By the removal of desire, misery is removed;
sn1.34:3.3: by the removal of misery, suffering is removed. ”
sn1.34:4.1: “They are not sense pleasures, the world’s pretty things:
sn1.34:4.2: Man’s sensuality is the intention of lust.
sn1.34:4.3: The pretty things remain as they are in the world
sn1.34:4.4: But the wise remove the desire for them.
sn1.34:5.1: “One should discard anger, cast off conceit,
sn1.34:5.3: Who does not adhere to name-and-form.
sn1.34:5.4: No sufferings torment one who has nothing,
sn1.34:6.1: “He abandoned reckoning, did not assume conceit;
sn1.34:6.2: He cut off craving here for name-and-form.
sn1.34:6.3: The one whose knots are cut, one untroubled, free of longing.
sn1.34:6.4: Searching for him  they do not find [him].
sn1.34:6.5: Devas and humans here and beyond,
sn1.34:6.6: in the heavens and in all abodes.”
sn1.34:7.1: “The one thus liberated, [they] have not seen,
sn1.34:7.3: “If devas and humans here or beyond,
sn1.34:7.4: The best of men, faring for the good of humans,
sn1.34:7.5: “Are they to be praised who venerate him?”
sn1.34:8.1: “Those bhikkhus too become worthy of praise,
sn1.34:8.3: “Who venerate him, the one thus liberated.
sn1.34:8.4: But having known Dhamma and abandoned doubt,
sn1.34:8.5: Those bhikkhus become even surmounters of ties. ”
